title: How to Make a Natural Curl Defining Cream with Hold

steps.headline: Pour the water and the flax seeds into a pot, bring your stove to low/medium heat and bring your mixture to a boil stirring the flaxseed often, and gently, with the wooden spoon
Turn off heat when a white frothy gel like liquid forms (it will have a raw egg white consistency).
Continue stirring while it simmers.
steps.description: Put the strainer on top of your bowl or container and pour the mixture in.

steps.headline: Let it cool down, and, if you want to, add aloe gel and essential oil
Keep the leftover flaxseeds in a zip lock bag for another use or two
Apply the gel.
steps.description: Use gel while hair is clean and damp to wet. It may be goopy, so you may have to adjust the recipe a bit by increasing or decreasing the amount of flax seed as you create it.

steps.headline: You may need to add some additional ingredients to your gel depending your requirements:
steps.description: If not moist enough you can add olive oil to your mix for a more nourishing gel. If your gel is too thin, try adding a bit more flaxseed to your next batch, add a touch of honey or experiment with a teaspoon of xanthan gum for a thickener. If your gel smells, adding an essential oil can make your gel and hair smell better

steps.headline: Mix all ingredients.
steps.description: Consistency should be lighter than a gel, but slightly thicker than your average styling cream.

steps.headline: Store in a jar or tub for later use.
steps.description: This doesn't need to be refrigerated
